intro: Vahlia verbasciflora, commonly known as the woolly vahlia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native region.
